sn21.11:1.2: Then Venerable Mahākappina went to see the Buddha.
sn21.11:1.3: The Buddha saw him coming off in the distance,
sn21.11:1.5: “Mendicants, do you see that monk coming—white, thin, with a pointy nose?”
sn21.11:1.7: “That mendicant is very mighty and powerful. It’s not easy to find an attainment that he has not already attained.
sn21.11:1.9: And he has realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. He lives having achieved with his own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.”
sn21.11:2.1: That is what the Buddha said.
sn21.11:2.2: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn21.11:3.2: who take clan as the standard.
sn21.11:3.3: But one accomplished in knowledge and conduct
sn21.11:3.4: is best among gods and humans.
sn21.11:4.4: and the brahmin shines in absorption.
sn21.11:4.5: But all day and all night,
